column5: Thanks for the info! We figured we were pushing it a bit, but didn't want to miss out as we all have the habit of getting too busy to get together.
is it worth trying the mouth of humber/etobicoke/ or credit rivers yet??  never fished for cats but willing to give it a try.  are there any carp around there?  never fished down here before.   ????
If you wait for 70 to 89F you will be waiting into july ...Omg Steve if thats the case why you taken clients out allready ...

FM donates free charters to the board for charity purposes on a yearly basis plus he gives up to date fishing reports to help people going down that way. No spam here. You sees things wrong me thinks.But thats just me.
There are definitely carp around there.  You should have a good time.

He mentioned the fishing was good and that a derby with no information is on. His only I.D. is in his signature. We as mod's read ALL posts and threads and we will adjust things as needed. If you feel that a post/thread is incorrect feel free to hit the report button in the left bottom of a thread and the next reading mod will rule on it. You are free to post your opinion that it is spam but realize that if you are wrong you will get a little razzing on the other side if you are right you will be the leader. The safe way is the report button but their is less drama with it. This BTW is for everyone who posts here I am not singling any one out it just was an opportunity to enlighten all of our friends here.   Art

Since I write down water temp every time I fish for cats. From my years of fishing for cat they start around 45F and get better as the water is around 55F. I have been out four times already have caught cats, but the bite is slow and so are the fish.I like my clients to catch lots of fish. You did not say how long it took to catch two fish.Two guys,two fish, how long? My trips are free if the fishing sucks.After the rain and warm weather this week. Next weekend should be good to go.
I want to go down in a week or 2, do you fish anywhere under the dam? or where the rocks are?

Hey Steve, errr, FISHMASTER, just wanted to thank you for your help on Saturday.  My father and I arrived after a long search for bait...without any luck. Steve had some great fresh sucker meat (non frozen).  We spoke for a few minutes while my father packed the boat. Steve confirmed my plan I had already - no moving. Pick a spot and stay there. That was our plan anyways, Steve just reconfirmed it.  When I arrived at our predetermined spot, we found it void of any anglers (there were about 15 boats on the river).  We setup our lines and within minutes I had my first cat on the line.  However, this one seemed tougher than the many cats we caught in the past. Well, that's cause it turned out to be huge.  First fish of the year - a personal best for me and my boat.  Called Steve from the river and he confirmed he would weigh my fish for me (even though his shop closed 3 hours earlier and i was not in his derby - THANKS!)  Met Steve at the ramp and he weighed my fish...our first 20lbs cat...official weight 20.55lbs.  Thanks Steve.  Another huge shutout should go to Steve Piggott.  He took me out a few years back and showed me how to "get'er done!"  If anyone is looking for some help, you know, to increase daily numbers from "a few" to "many", either Fishmaster or Steve Piggott (Anglers Way) are great choices!  My success can easily be attributed to both of their help and guidance!  On the water shot:    In the shop shot: (and of course was released)
Wow! Steve that is a beaut! Congrats on the PB.
Hey Steve, no credit to the camera man? I'll be sure to remember that when I'm snapping pics of your next PB
Was that the only one you caught ?
Great stuff Stevie Hamilton.... good to see you posting some pics again!!
What a beauty.  Another spot that is on the list.
another spot?
hoping to get down for some cat action what else is bitting out ther in this part of the river

Well guys and gals the Cat season has started ...fished the rocks out front of the store today and can you say FISH-ON all fish caught on fresh brined cut bait  3 oz slip sinker with 4/0 and 5/0 circle hooks ....Derby Starts Friday April 1st till May 8th  Luke with a 22lber
Holy sow!
Very nice. Good luck in the derby!
Awesome.
Dang...i thought it was another pussy cat thread.  But your cats are truly awsome
Great !!! Now everyones gonna be there this weekend for pussy cats
I'm thinking that would be Steve's plan
I'm a gonna launch!
yup nothin like a little    in the mornin
Where is your store...?
Oh No !!! Did i start sumfin again
some awesome spring cats for sure bud!!!!   cheers
Nice. I'm gonna try and go out this weekend for some of those.

That's awesome Steve, thanks for letting everyone know.  I have been waiting to hear that they are back!  In regards to the comment by  "Brifishrgy" ... in what way shape or form is it spam when someone posts that they are catching fish, and they include the bait and on what rig?  This is a fishing site and also a community made up of some of the very best fishermen and women in Southern Ontario and beyond.  I come here for information, to see who is catching fish and where and more often than not to read and enjoy the adventures of others.  There is a great amount of joy and pleasure posted on these pages.  Please think about that in the future when posting negative opinions or comments, as they certainly have an inpact on the overall feel of a post and this forum.  Channel Cats start to run up the rivers and streams from the lake in the spring to breed, they can be caught in many areas, the fact that Fishmaster has posted that he is catching them in no way shape or form is spam, it is a "fishing related post".  Cats can be caught anywhere and with almost anything...  The Channel Cat Derby is a 100% cash back derby...  I know lots of people who were waiting on hearing that the cats are in the river, thanks so much to Steve and Luke.   I know my family will be out there chasing after a fish that beats the almost 30lber last year.
I call it as I see it, at least he actually had some pictures this year
Nice cats.
I was waiting to see a report before I headed down that way, thanks!
Thanks for posting steve, see ya soon!
Purdy big cats    Congrats
Scary big!  I can't imagine what the fight is like as I've never hooked into a cat that big.  Gonna have to try to get me some of that!
Gave it a shot today with a couple buddies.  No fish, no bites. Maybe the fish were playing an april fools joke on us, but I'm not laughing.
qith today's fuel costs, I welcome all reports of fish from "far away places"  ..... keep em coming please
Gotta get'em when the suns out shinning right now...still early but if you can get out when the suns beating on you, still early season the bite will improve but you get the bigguns now.
Yeah we went on april 13th last year and were "too late" I guess this year we were too early. We'll be back when it warms up a bit. At least we had fun playing fetch with fishmasters dog.

The water in the river is 38F the best temps for cats is 70F to89F the cats are there but they are not going to travel far to get bait.That being said if you get your bait near the fish they will eat Last year at this time the water in the river was 52 F a big difference we need a week of warm weather or warm rains to get the cat moving.
